{{This date in recent years}}
{{Day}}

The terms '''7th July''', '''July 7th''', and '''7/7''' (pronounced "'''Seven-seven'''") have been widely used in the Western media as a shorthand for the [[7 July 2005 London bombings|7 July 2005 bombings]] on London's [[Transport in London|transport system]]. In the Chinese language, this term is used to denote the [[Marco Polo Bridge Incident|Battle of Lugou Bridge]] started on July 7, 1937, marking the beginning of the [[Second Sino-Japanese War]].

==Events==
*[[1456]] &ndash; A [[Retrial of Joan of Arc|retrial verdict]] acquits [[Joan of Arc]] of [[Heresy in Christianity|heresy]] 25 years after her death.
*[[1520]] &ndash; Spanish ''[[conquistador]]es'' defeat a larger [[Aztec Triple Alliance|Aztec]] army at the [[Battle of Otumba]].
*[[1534]] &ndash; [[European colonization of the Americas]]: first known exchange between Europeans and natives of the [[Gulf of Saint Lawrence|Gulf of St. Lawrence]] in [[New Brunswick]].
*[[1543]] &ndash; French troops invade [[Luxembourg]].
*[[1575]] &ndash; [[Raid of the Redeswire]], the last major battle between [[Kingdom of England|England]] and [[Kingdom of Scotland|Scotland]].
*[[1585]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Nemours]] abolishes tolerance to [[Protestantism|Protestants]] in France.
*[[1770]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Larga]] between the [[Russian Empire]] and the [[Ottoman Empire]] takes place.
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: American forces retreating from [[Fort Ticonderoga]] are defeated in the [[Battle of Hubbardton]].
*[[1798]] &ndash; [[Quasi-War]]: the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] rescinds treaties with France sparking the "[[war]]".
*[[1807]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: the [[Treaties of Tilsit|Peace of Tilsit]] between France, [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussia]] and Russia ends the [[War of the Fourth Coalition]].
*[[1834]] &ndash; In New York City, [[Anti-abolitionist riots (1834)|four nights of rioting]] against [[Abolitionism in the United States|abolitionists]] began.
*[[1846]] &ndash; [[Mexican–American War]]: American troops occupy [[Monterey, California|Monterey]] and [[San Francisco|Yerba Buena]], thus beginning the U.S. acquisition of [[California]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; United States begins its first [[Conscription|military draft]]; exemptions cost $300.
*[[1865]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: four conspirators in the assassination of President [[Abraham Lincoln]] are hanged.
*[[1892]] &ndash; [[Katipunan]]: the Revolutionary Philippine Brotherhood is established, contributing to the fall of the [[Spanish Empire]] in Asia.
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[William McKinley]] signs the [[Newlands Resolution]] annexing Hawaii as a territory of the United States.
*[[1907]] &ndash; [[Florenz Ziegfeld, Jr.]] staged his first [[Ziegfeld Follies|Follies]] on the roof of the [[Bowery Theatre|New York Theater]] in [[New York City]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; The United States, Great Britain, Japan, and Russia sign the [[North Pacific Fur Seal Convention of 1911]] banning open-water [[seal hunting]], the first international treaty to address wildlife preservation issues.
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: end of [[First Battle of the Isonzo]].
*  1915   &ndash; An [[International Railway (New York – Ontario)|International Railway]] [[Tram|trolley]] with an extreme overload of 157 passengers crashes near [[Queenston, Ontario]], killing 15.
*  1915   &ndash; Militia officer [[Henry Pedris]] executed by firing squad at [[Colombo]], [[Sri Lanka|Ceylon]] - an act widely regarded as a miscarriage of justice by the British colonial authorities.
*[[1928]] &ndash; [[Sliced bread]] is sold for the first time (on [[Otto Frederick Rohwedder|the inventor's]] [[July 7#Births|48th birthday]]) by the Chillicothe Baking Company of [[Chillicothe, Missouri]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; Industrialist [[Henry J. Kaiser]] begins construction of the Boulder Dam (now known as [[Hoover Dam]]).
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Second Sino-Japanese War]]: [[Marco Polo Bridge Incident|Battle of Lugou Bridge]] &ndash; Japanese forces invade Beijing, China.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: U.S. forces land in [[Iceland]], taking over from an earlier British occupation.
*  1941   &ndash; World War II: [[Beirut]] is occupied by [[Free French Forces|Free France]] and British troops.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: Largest [[Banzai charge]] of the [[Pacific War]] at the [[Battle of Saipan]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; Mother [[Francesca S. Cabrini]] becomes the first American to be canonized.
*  1946   &ndash; [[Howard Hughes]] nearly dies when his [[Hughes XF-11|XF-11]] [[reconnaissance aircraft]] prototype crashes in a [[Beverly Hills, California|Beverly Hills]] neighborhood.
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[Roswell incident]], the (supposed) crash of an [[Extraterrestrial life|alien]] [[spaceship]] near [[Roswell, New Mexico|Roswell]] in [[New Mexico]].
*[[1952]] &ndash; The [[ocean liner]] {{SS|United States}} passes [[Bishop Rock, Isles of Scilly|Bishop Rock]] on her maiden voyage, breaking the [[Blue Riband|transatlantic speed record]] to become the fastest passenger ship in the world.
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Che Guevara|Ernesto "Che" Guevara]] sets out on a [[Che Guevara#Guatemala, Arbenz and United Fruit|trip]] through [[Bolivia]], [[Peru]], [[Ecuador]], [[Panama]], [[Costa Rica]], [[Nicaragua]], [[Honduras]], and [[El Salvador]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Elvis Presley]] makes his radio debut when WHBQ Memphis played his first recording for Sun Records, "That's All Right."
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Fritz Moravec]] and two other Austrian mountaineers make the first ascent of [[Gasherbrum II]] (8,035 m).
*[[1958]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] signs the [[Alaska Statehood Act]] into [[Law of the United States|law]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Venus]] [[Occultation|occults]] the star [[Regulus]]. This rare event is used to determine the diameter of Venus and the structure of the Venusian atmosphere.
*[[1978]] &ndash; The [[Solomon Islands]] becomes independent from the [[United Kingdom]]
*[[1980]] &ndash; Institution of [[sharia]] in [[Iran]].
*  1980   &ndash; During the [[Lebanese Civil War]], 83 [[Tigers Militia|Tiger]] militants are killed during what will be known as the [[Safra massacre]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Ronald Reagan]] appoints [[Sandra Day O'Connor]] to become the first female member of the [[Supreme Court of the United States]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: [[Samantha Smith]], a U.S. schoolgirl, flies to the [[Soviet Union]] at the invitation of [[List of leaders of the Soviet Union|Secretary General]] [[Yuri Andropov]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Boris Becker]] becomes the youngest player ever to win [[The Championships, Wimbledon|Wimbledon]] at age 17
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Yugoslav Wars]]: the [[Brijuni Agreement|Brioni Agreement]] ends the [[Ten-Day War|ten-day independence war]] in [[Slovenia]] against the rest of the [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; The [[Turkish Armed Forces]] withdraw from northern [[Iraq]] after [[Operation Hammer (1997)|assisting]] the [[Kurdistan Democratic Party]] in the [[Iraqi Kurdish Civil War]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; A scandal breaks out in the United Kingdom when news reports accuse [[Secret Intelligence Service|MI6]] of sheltering [[Abu Qatada]], the supposed European [[Al-Qaeda]] leader.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[NASA]] [[Opportunity rover]], MER-B or Mars Exploration Rover – B, was launched into space aboard a [[Delta II]] rocket.
*[[2005]] &ndash; A series of [[7 July 2005 London bombings|four explosions]] occurs on [[Transport in London|London's transport system]] killing 56 people including four alleged [[suicide bombers]] and injuring over 700 others.
*[[2012]] &ndash; At least 172 people are killed in a [[2012 Russian floods|flash flood]] in the [[Krasnodar Krai]] region of [[Russia]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; A [[De Havilland Otter]] [[air taxi]] [[2013 Rediske Air Otter crash|crashes]] in [[Soldotna, Alaska]], killing 10 people.
